titles.title: Federal Agency Access Act of 1994
To require each Federal agency to use stationary on which is printed the telephone number of the agency.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E848)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E867)
Referred to the House Committee on Government Operations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Legislation and National Security.

bill.summary: 5/5/1994--Introduced. Federal Agency Access Act of 1994 - Directs the head of each Federal agency to: (1) require that all agency correspondence be placed on stationery that includes the agency telephone number; and (2) submit a status report to the Congress on compliance with this Act.
